intro: Ortholoma dissimile, commonly known as the slender ortholoma, is a flowering plant native to California. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It has finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, round fruits. Ortholoma dissimile is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a rare species in its native range.
